citation.article-title: Haloplanus natans gen. nov., sp. nov., an extremely halophilic, gas-vacuolate archaeon isolated from Dead Sea-Red Sea water mixtures in experimental outdoor ponds.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Haloplanus (Ha.lo.pla′nus. Gr. n. hals, halos salt; L. adj. planus flat; N.L. masc. n. Haloplanus flat salt-life form).
Cells are pleomorphic, flat and contain gas vesicles.
In static liquid culture the cells float to the surface.
The genomic DNA G+C content is 66.1–66.4 mol% (as determined by HPLC).
The type species is Haloplanus natans.
